56121149.title: RegEx for escaping special characters
56121149.body:
Trying RegExp to generate regular expression for string matching. Got confused with escaping specified in the docs. Whenever using RegExp constructor type input string need to escaped using function provided in that docs.     

Properly working with literal approach

 "test".match(/te*/gi)


Output:


  [ 'te', 't' ]


When I tried same thing with RegExp constructor output varies.

rg="te*"
function escapeRegExp(str) {
   return str.replace(/[\-\[\]\/\{\}\(\)\*\+\?\.\\\^\$\|]/g, "\\$&");
}

exp = new RegExp(escapeRegExp(rg),'gi')
console.log("exp =>", exp);
console.log("test".match(exp));


Output:


  exp => /te*/gi 
  
  null


Will it be there any backslashes before '*'? Is it properly escaped? Why the regex generated is different from literal expression?
I couldn't figure out what I am missing from that doc.

I appreciate the help to point out mistake available here!

My approach was to edit the original json and calling update(root), but the text is not updated until the element is collapsed and redrawn (when i click the parent).

// Enter any new nodes at the parent's previous position.
  nodeEnter.append("rect")
      .attr("y", -barHeight / 2)
      .attr("height", barHeight)
      .attr("width", barWidth)
      .style("fill", color)
      .on("click", click);

  nodeEnter.append("text")
      .attr("dy", 3.5)
      .attr("dx", 5.5)
      .text(function(d) { return d.data.name; });


This code snippet is what modifies the element's text but is only triggered when the element isnt drawn already.

56121232.title: How can I use a queryselect in tinyMCE?
56121232.body:
I am on a page that uses a tinyMCE htmleditor for creating some HTML. For a client that is using the form, I need to use some JAvascript to change one of the text elements in a span. I have access to the editor and it's enabled to allow javascript.

using the chrome inspector dev tool, I am able to get/copy the JS path to the element I want to change. It is the following

document.querySelector("#form > strong > strong > strong > div > strong > span:nth-child(2) > div.tn-fields > table > tbody > tr:nth-child(11) > td > span")

To change the text in the span, in the chrome console, I can just do:
document.querySelector("#form > strong > strong > strong > div > strong > span:nth-child(2) > div.tn-fields > table > tbody > tr:nth-child(11) > td > span").innerHTML='My new value' and it works. 

I now want to copy/paste this into the tinyMCE editor in some  tags to have it run when the form loads. 

However, whenever I copy this in, the editor converts the ">" character to the " "& gt;" character, therefore breaking the javascript.

Is there any way to specify this queryselect for what I want in the editor and not have the character escaped? I've tried a number of things, none of which worked. Based on the query select above, is there a format that would be more friendly to use?

56121496.title: Html canvas image upload through ajax
56121496.body:
A year ago I tried to upload a canvas picture through ajax to my server for OCR purpose, main issues were the DPI of the picture which was too low resulting in an error with TesseractOCR and the fact that it had to be sent as a base64 string which would result in browser crash/freeze when using the targeted devices which are mobile phones. 

My objective is to create an html page that live-scans using the phone's camera and if a specific pattern of number is found, return a true result and fill a part of a present form (like the Amazon android app that scans your credit card and fills the input).

Is there a way to achieve this without a page reload and through ajax ? I am aware that a traditional file upload would allow the image to be fully sent and better for OCR instead of a low sized dpi canvas drawn.

56121522.title: Allow CORS header causes ERR_INVALID_HTTP_RESPONSE
56121522.body:
I'm trying to send a POST request to localhost and was getting an error about CORS not being allowed. I added an "Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *" header among other things based on what other people have suggested, but am now getting a different error: "ERR_INVALID_HTTP_RESPONSE". I'd really appreciate it if someone could tell me what I'm getting wrong!

server side code

import BaseHTTPServer
import json
import csv

HOST_NAME = 'localhost' 
PORT_NUMBER = 9000 

class MyHandler(BaseHTTPServer.BaseHTTPRequestHandler):
    def do_OPTIONS(self):
        self.send_response(200)
        self.send_header('Access-Control-Allow-Origin', '*')
        self.send_header('Access-Control-Allow-Methods', 'POST')
        self.send_header('Access-Control-Allow-Headers', 'Access-Control-Allow-Headers, Origin, Accept, X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Access-Control-Request-Method, Access-Control-Request-Headers')

    def do_POST(self):
        self.send_response(200)
        self.send_header('Content-Type', 'application/json')
        self.end_headers()
        # send some json as response


client side code

axios.post('http://localhost:9000', {
    'cat': 'meow meow meow'
  })
    .then(function (response) {
      console.log(response);
  })
    .catch(function (error) {
      console.log(error);
  });



This is what the console shows:

spread.js:25 OPTIONS http://localhost:9000/ net::ERR_INVALID_HTTP_RESPONSE
(anonymous) @ spread.js:25
e.exports @ spread.js:25
e.exports @ spread.js:25
Promise.then (async)
r.request @ spread.js:25
r.(anonymous function) @ spread.js:25
(anonymous) @ index.js:20
(anonymous) @ (index):232
i @ jquery.min.js:2
fireWith @ jquery.min.js:2
z @ jquery.min.js:4
(anonymous) @ jquery.min.js:4
load (async)
send @ jquery.min.js:4
ajax @ jquery.min.js:4
n.(anonymous function) @ jquery.min.js:4
onSuccess @ (index):221
connected @ link-initialize.js:1
(anonymous) @ link-initialize.js:1
(index):239 Error: Network Error
    at e.exports (spread.js:25)
    at XMLHttpRequest.l.onerror (spread.js:25)



Am I using do_OPTIONS correctly? What about send_response(200) and end_headers()?

56121630.title: EventSource misses first messages before addEventListener
56121630.body:
How to prevent new EventSource from missing first messages before addEventListener called (in pure vanilla JS)?

The problem is race condition between start data receiving and handler subscribing due to non atomic operation create-subscribe.
It would be nice to have a way to create EventSource in closed state or pass subscribers right into constructor.

I can see two workarounds:


to have additional API to notify server that listeners are ready or to request first data after subscribers set
to add some sleep timeout in server before initial data transfer.


They both are ugly enough to not even try to use SSE and go to WebSocket. But it's another question.

56122349.title: Is there a selector string in the matches method that will return true for any HTML tag of the parent?
56122349.body:
In trying to convert a set of individual event listeners into one listener on the parent container conditioned using the matches method on the evt.target, I've run into a bit of difficulty. One of the elements in the parent can have an unknown number of user added elements that may also have children, grand children, etcetera. Using evt.target returns the child element. Is there a selector string using matches or another method than can have the same effect as placing the event on the element and using evt.currentTarget? For example, this is similar to the HTML I'm dealing with and I want to place the event listener on div of id="parent".
Most of it works fine, but the div under the textarea inside div.text is the problem. A mouse event on div.text is all that is needed but the event is on the parent. Many tr elements and many divisions of class="text" may be added by the user and the inner div can be filled with user-selected tags within tags. My question is how can I capture a mouse event on any tag within div.text > div or the div.text, apart from having to give each tag an additional class? Using matches( '.text *' ), as I read in one of the questions here, works if click on the textarea or an empty area of the inner div, but if click on one of its children then it doesn't match. I don't think this the same as desiring a parent selector in CSS, because I want any child of the parent regardless of tag type. I appreciate any guidance you may be able to provide. Thank you.

56122359.title: Is there an example of negotiation flow between Websocket in JavaScript and a Web Server
56122359.body:
I want to use Web-socket in my angular application to communicate with a local Socket Server. I have managed to successfully establish a connection. However, sending data between client and server results in an error: "Invalid frame header". I am trying to make sense of the specification document found at: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7692 However I would appreciate any example to help me get started.

I have successfully negotiated the handshaking between client and server.

The browser sent the following:

 GET / HTTP/1.1 
 Host: localhost:12345
 Connection: Upgrade
 Pragma: no-cache
 Cache-Control: no-cache
 Upgrade: websocket
 Origin: http://localhost:4200
 Sec-WebSocket-Version: 13
 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/74.0.3729.131 Safari/537.36
 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate, br
 Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.9
 Sec-WebSocket-Key: wlTf/efNPJgQzFukms9oag== 
 Sec-WebSocket-Extensions: permessage-deflate
 client_max_window_bits
 Sec-WebSocket-Protocol: chat


The server responded with:

 HTTP/1.1 101 Switching Protocols'
 Upgrade: websocket 
 Connection: Upgrade
 Sec-WebSocket-Accept: htJ7pR3Vq9CS+efjOxJU1s9wq2Y=
 Sec-WebSocket-Extensions: permessage-deflate
 Sec-WebSocket-Protocol: chat


How do I now 'frame' the message coming from either the browser or the server.
I suppose that I need to 'package' the outgoing/incoming messages at the server's end to facilitate the successful transfer on messages between the browser and the server. Any example would be appreciated.

   measureDate: '""2016-11-07T02:41:18.000Z""',

   measureDate: '""2016-11-09T15:39:57.000Z""',
   __v: 0 } ]



Relevant Imports:


import { pluck } from 'rxjs/operators';
import { map } from 'rxjs/operators'; // (shows map not being utilized for some reason, have already installed rxjs compact) 
import { from } from 'rxjs';


Code


    this.weightdevicesService.getweightdevicesbypatient(this.userId)
      .subscribe((weightdevices: Weightdevices[]) => {
        this.weightdevices = weightdevices;
      });
    console.log(this.weightdevices);
    const source = from(this.weightdevices); //changes to observable 
    const hfilter = source.pipe(pluck('height')); // pluck to filter out data to [ '55.9', '57.2' ]
    console.log(hfilter);
    const hfilterob = from(hfilter);  // ensures it is observable - this dosent seem to make a difference?

This results in the error
